intro: Dicliptera gracilirama, commonly known as slender-leaved dicliptera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in wet, marshy habitats and is often found in swampy areas near rivers or in seasonally flooded grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
